studyMetadata.title: SME Evaluation Survey: Digital Visual Media Forensics Ontology
studyMetadata.description: A survey to evaluate the structure, completeness, and utility of a Digital Visual Media Forensics ontology.

response.prompt: Statement of Consent
options: I have read the information and agree to participate in this study.
I do not agree to participate in this study.

response.prompt: How many years of experience do you have in the field of digital media forensics or a related area?
Which of the following modalities do you specialize in? (Select all that apply)
If you would like to elaborate more on your specialized modalities, please use the text box below.
Please rate your familiarity with the following general manipulation types:
questionOptions: Synthetic Generation (e.g. GANs, Diffusion-generated, Text-to-Image/Video, Deepfakes)

overview_video.instruction:
Please watch the entire video above. Once the video finishes, press Next to continue.

If the video is not visible, please refresh the page.

Alternatively, you can open the video in a new browser window by clicking the link below:

[Overview Video on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m3-eLk1L3oM)

overall_structure.instruction:
## In this section, we will evaluate the overall structure of the ontology. 

 While the study of the ontology is not on the interface, rather the structure of the ontology, it is helpful to understand and make most of it.

response.prompt: Click *Expand All* in the **Tree View**, then select the **Deepfakes** nodeâ€”its description, associated terms, and associated papers will appear in the right-hand panel. How many papers are listed for the **Deepfakes** node?
Switch to **Dendrogram View** and look at the overall structure. Which of the four main branches appears to have the most sub-branches radiating from it?

Switch to **Sunburst View**. Click on any colored section to zoom in, then use the breadcrumb trail or reset button to return to the full view. Select **completed** when you've tried the zoom-in feature.
response.placeholder: Select **completed** when you've tried the zoom-in feature.

response.prompt: The ontology is divided into four main branches: (1) Modality, (2) Forensic Goal & Task, (3) Evidentiary Features, and (4) Search & Analysis Scope. And the overall four-branch division is logical and intuitive.
Please explain your rating.
Please provide any general comments on this high-level structure. For example, do you believe a major branch is missing or that two branches should be combined?

branch_modality.instruction:
## In this section, we will evaluate the structure and grouping of nodes within the **Target Modality** branch. 

 Please spend some time to understand the structure of this branch through your preferred view.

response.prompt: **[Organization]** The structure and grouping of nodes within the Target Modality branch is logical and effective.
response.secondaryText: Example: Should there be a "multimodal" node in this branch?

response.prompt: Please explain your rating.
**[Completeness]** Are there any significant media types or modalities missing from this branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Should "3D/Spatial Media" be added as a distinct modality to reflect emerging technologies like AR/VR)

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is missing and why.
**[Correctness]** Is anything in this branch misplaced? Does any node belong in a different branch entirely?
response.secondaryText: Example: As supportive modalities for visual media analysis, should "text" and "audio" be standalone modalites in this branch?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is misplaced and why.
**[Naming & Clarity]** Are any of the node names within this branch ambiguous, incorrect, or confusing?
response.secondaryText: Example: Does the label "Video" clearly convey its intended scope? Would "Moving Image" be more precise to avoid conflating it with associated audio content?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is unclear and why.
**[Additional Comments]** If there's anything about this branch you'd like to comment on that wasn't addressed in the previous questions, please use the text box below.

branch_manipulation.instruction:
## In this section, we will evaluate the structure and grouping of nodes within the **Forensic Goal & Task** branch. 

 Please spend some time to understand the structure of this branch through your preferred view.

response.prompt: **[Organization]** The structure and grouping of nodes within the Forensic Goal & Task branch is logical and effective.
response.secondaryText: Example: Should modality be considered as a factor when organizing this branch? For example, splitting "Forgery & Manipulation Detection" based on if the media is a video or an image.

response.prompt: Please explain your rating.
**[Completeness]** Are there any significant manipulation techniques or forensic tasks for digital visual media missing from this branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Any "Signal-level Post-processing" other than "Compression" is missing? "Cheapfake" should be added to this branch somewhere?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is missing and why.
**[Correctness]** Is anything in this branch misplaced? Does any node belong in a different branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Does it make sense to place "Steganography" under "Forgery & Manipulation Detection"?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is misplaced and why.
**[Naming & Clarity]** Are any of the node names within this branch ambiguous, incorrect, or confusing?
response.secondaryText: Example: Should it be "Content Synthesis" or "Content Generation"? Are "Content Rearrangement" and "Content Synthesis" intuitive namings for understanding the splitting logic?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is unclear and why.
**[Additional Comments]** If there's anything about this branch you'd like to comment on that wasn't addressed in the previous questions, please use the text box below.

branch_feature.instruction:
## In this section, we will evaluate the structure and grouping of nodes within the **Evidentiary Features** branch. 

 Please spend some time to understand the structure of this branch through your preferred view.

response.prompt: **[Organization]** The structure and grouping of nodes within the Evidentiary Features branch is logical and effective.
response.secondaryText: Example: Is it reasonable to split this branch into mathematical features and signs that humans can identify?

response.prompt: Please explain your rating.
**[Completeness]** Are there any significant feature families or specific forensic cues for digital visual media missing from this branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Should there be a dedicated category for "Scene Semantics", especially for detecting inconsistencies in scene composition? Any other specific "Temporal Features" other than "Optical Flow Field" should be treated as a standalone node?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is missing and why.
**[Correctness]** Is anything in this branch misplaced? Does any node belong in a different branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Should "Compression Artifacts" be placed under "Metadata & File Structure"? Should "MFCC" be placed under "Frequency Features" or "Temporal Features"?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is misplaced and why.
**[Naming & Clarity]** Are any of the node names within this branch ambiguous, incorrect, or confusing?
response.secondaryText: Example: Does "High-level Semantic Features" vs "Low-level Signal Features" sound clearer than the current first level splitting?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is unclear and why.
**[Additional Comments]** If there's anything about this branch you'd like to comment on that wasn't addressed in the previous questions, please use the text box below.

branch_scope.instruction:
## In this section, we will evaluate the structure and grouping of nodes within the **Search & Analysis Scope** branch. 

 Please spend some time to understand the structure of this branch though your preferred view.

response.prompt: **[Organization]** The structure and grouping of nodes within the Search & Analysis Scope branch is logical and effective.
response.secondaryText: Example: Does it make sense to have one spatial branch and one temporal branch?

response.prompt: Please explain your rating.
**[Completeness]** Are there any particular analysis scopes for digital visual media missing from this branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Should we consider "Captions", "Transcripts", and so on from supportive modalities (Text & Audio) here in this branch? Patch/Block is not included in the current branch, should it be added back under "Spatial Granularity"?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is missing and why.
**[Correctness]** Is anything in this branch misplaced? Does any node belong in a different branch?
response.secondaryText: Example: Should "Full Face" be a standalone node as a "ROI"?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what you believe is misplaced and why.
**[Naming & Clarity]** Are any of the node names within this branch ambiguous, incorrect, or confusing?
response.secondaryText: Example: Is "Short Window/Segment" intuitive enough? What if the selection is not consecutive frames?

response.prompt: If you select Yes, please explain what is unclear.
**[Additional Comments]** If there's anything about this branch you'd like to comment on that wasn't addressed in the previous questions, please use the text box below.
Which view did you find most helpful for understanding the ontology's structure?
Please explain your selection.
Do you have any suggestions for improving the usability or features of the interactive viewer? Please describe anything that was confusing, hard to use, or could be made more efficient.
Based on your expertise, what do you see as the most significant gap or missing element in this ontology as a whole?
The ontology could be useful for the following applications:
Do you foresee any other applications for this ontology? Please explain.

A key goal for this ontology is to be a living framework that can be extended by the community. How easy or difficult do you believe it would be to extend the current structure as new technologies emerge?
Please explain your rating.
Do you have any final thoughts, concerns, or suggestions for improving the ontology or its use?
The study is anonymous, but if you'd like to provide your email for us to contact you later, please enter it below. We will de-identified the data when performing the analysis.

skip.name: consent
skip.value: I do not agree to participate in this study.
